item.title: Flight carrying 242 people bound for London has crashed in Ahmedabad, India
item.description: An Air India flight with 242 passengers and crew that was bound for London crashed in India's northwestern city of Ahmedabad shortly after departure.

item.title: London-bound Air India flight with more than 240 aboard crashes in Ahmedabad, India
item.description: A Boeing 787 crashed into a residential area in Ahmedabad city five minutes after taking off. The flight was bound for London's Gatwick Airport. There were more than 240 people onboard.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Despite ongoing Taliban threats, the U.S. is ending some protections for Afghans
item.description: Thousands of Afghans in the U.S. fear deportation as the administration revokes some protections, despite Taliban threats and ongoing instability in Afghanistan. Many fear for their lives if forced to return.

item.description: The Trump administration has a novel strategy to boost arrests and reduce courts' backlog: dismissing people's immigration cases and immediately arresting them.

item.title: House GOP plan to gut green energy tax credits meets resistance in Senate
item.description: Several Republican senators say they're opposed to the wholescale repeal of certain clean energy tax credits passed by the House. Their phones have been ringing off the hook from industry leaders and energy lobbyists who want to make sure the Senate makes changes to the bill.

item.title: Majorities in key U.S. allies have no confidence in Trump's global leadership
item.description: People in 15 of 24 countries downgraded ratings of the U.S., according to the survey of more than 28,000. Majorities in almost every country surveyed describe Trump as "arrogant" and "dangerous."
